title: Managed Pressure Drilling (MPD)
description: MPD uses surface back pressure to precisely control bottomhole pressure, enabling drilling in narrow windows where conventional methods fail. This module covers MPD principles, equipment, control modes, operations matrix decision-making, and well control protocols based on real operational procedures.
objectives: Understand MPD principles, equipment, and control modes
Apply the MPD Operations Matrix (Green/Yellow/Orange/Red zones)
Execute MPD connections maintaining constant BHP
Recognize and respond to influxes using MPD techniques
Understand Driller authority and transition protocols
Interpret flow-in vs flow-out for kick/loss detection (0.1 bbl sensitivity)

keyTopics.content: Conventional static: BHP = Hydrostatic Head (HH). Conventional dynamic: ECD = HH + Annular Friction Loss (AFL). MPD dynamic: ECD = HH + AFL + Surface Back Pressure (SBP). MPD static (connections): BHP = HH + Increased SBP. SBP adjustment is significantly quicker, has more range, and is more accurate than pump-speed adjustments.

Five control modes govern pressure management: 1) SBP Mode - maintains user-defined surface backpressure setpoint; 2) Standpipe Pressure Mode - maintains SPP at selected setpoint; 3) Flow Control Mode - equalizes flow-in to flow-out, closes choke during influx, opens during losses; 4) Manual Mode - user-defined choke position; 5) P@D (Pressure at Depth) Mode - model-based control calculating pressure at anchor point, automatically compensates for rotation, pipe movement, pump rate changes.

Four-zone decision framework: GREEN ZONE - Normal drilling within optimum envelope. YELLOW ZONE - Parameters approaching limits, safe reaction time to adjust and circulate influx via MPD. ORANGE ZONE - One operating limit met, stop drilling, reduce rotation, continue circulating via MPD until stabilized. RED ZONE - Maximum parameters exceeded, immediately secure well, isolate MPD, conventional well control takes over.

MPD with automatic choke control and Coriolis mass-flow meters can detect influxes as low as 0.1 bbl via delta flow (flow-out vs flow-in). Conventional drilling typically detects 5-10 bbl gains. This early detection is a key MPD advantage. Positive kick indicators: pit volume gain (unattributable to surface), increased return flow rate, well flowing with pumps off.

Well-specific influx threshold determines MPD vs conventional response. Example: 2 bbl threshold means influxes <2 bbl can be circulated via MPD without BOP activation; volumes â‰¥2 bbl trigger BOP shut-in. Threshold considers: wellhead pressure limits, influx fluid type, MGS capacity, piping geometry, kick detection accuracy, wellbore geometry.

The Driller maintains primary well control responsibility during MPD operations. Critical policy: The Driller has unilateral authority to shut in the well without recourse to any supervisor if a suspected well control event is occurring or for any other reason deemed necessary. This authority is absolute and must never be questioned.

At least two tested and independent safety barriers must be present. In MPD, the primary barrier is hydrostatic pressure + annular friction + applied SBP. The secondary barrier is the BOP system. Policy: In the event of an unplanned influx or well control incident, the MPD system shall be isolated and the rig's well control system shall take over.

RCD (Rotating Control Device) - maintains annular closure with dynamic and static pressure ratings. DSIT (Drill String Isolation Tool) - isolates wellbore during RCD element changes. Flow Spool - routes closed-loop returns through MPD system. Coriolis Flowmeters - measures mass flow in/out for delta flow detection. MPD Chokes - electrically actuated 6" and 3" with remote PRVs. MGS (Mud Gas Separator) - sized for allowable influx volumes.

Pre-connection: capture pick-up/slack-off weights, pit volumes before pump rate reduction and after stabilization. During connection: P@D mode (preferred) automatically closes chokes to compensate for ECD loss when rotation stops. Standpipe bleed-back to zero via mini trip tank verifies float integrity. Ramp-up: pick up, remove slips, rotate at 30 rpm, bring pumps online at 20-30 spm, stage pumps gradually as SPP recovers.

Auto Kick Detection generates warning on HMI. Confirm via primary indicators. Switch to Flow Control mode to equalize. If Flow Control reaches high limit, system automatically reverts to Manual mode with BOP closure prompt. Once stable, switch to P@D mode with Well Depth anchor point. Stop rotation, pick up, space out. Ramp down drill string pumps (P@D automatically adjusts choke). When pumps off, follow BOP shut-in procedures.

Riser de-gassing takes precedence over downhole well kill operations. Use SBP mode with boost pump at 450 gpm, typical SBP <200 psi. Route returns through MPD system to MGS. Monitor indicators: flow-out exceeding flow-in (gas expansion), density reduction at surface, flow meter signal loss at high gas percentages. Continue until mud density stabilizes at full active mud density.

yellowZone.action: Safe reaction time available - adjust parameters and circulate influx via MPD system

orangeZone.action: Stop drilling, reduce rotation, continue circulating via MPD until stabilized

redZone.action: Immediately secure well, isolate MPD system, conventional well control procedures take over

sbp.name: Surface Back Pressure
sbp.description: Maintains user-defined surface backpressure setpoint independent of downhole changes
sbp.use: Alternative mode during connections when P@D unavailable

standpipePressure.name: Standpipe Pressure
standpipePressure.description: Automatically maintains standpipe pressure at selected setpoint
standpipePressure.use: Influx circulation - increase setpoint 50 psi above normal

flowControl.name: Flow Control
flowControl.description: Equalizes flow-in to flow-out; closes choke during influx, opens during losses
flowControl.use: Initial influx response - confirms kick and stabilizes well

manual.name: Manual
manual.description: User-defined choke position via operator input
manual.use: Fallback when automated modes fail or system reverts

pressureAtDepth.name: Pressure at Depth (P@D)
pressureAtDepth.description: Model-based control at anchor point; compensates for rotation, pipe movement, pump rate, density, cuttings
pressureAtDepth.use: Preferred mode for drilling and connections

bhpEquations.mpdDynamic: ECD = HH + AFL + SBP (Surface Back Pressure)
bhpEquations.mpdStatic: BHP = HH + Increased SBP (compensates for lost AFL)

trainingRequirements.level3: Well-specific simulator training (well challenges, communication, non-routine situations)

operationalPrinciples: P@D mode is preferred - it automatically compensates for ECD changes
Flow Control mode is your first response to suspected influx
MPD detects influxes as low as 0.1 bbl - 50x better than conventional
Know your influx threshold - above it means BOP, below it means MPD circulation
The Driller has absolute authority to shut in without supervisor approval
Riser de-gassing takes precedence over downhole well kill
Two barriers must always be maintained - MPD is primary, BOP is secondary
RED zone = immediate MPD isolation and conventional well control
